verses.roman:
bāulake kahiha,--loka ha-ila bāula
bāulake kahiha,--hāṭe nā vikāya cāula

synonyms: bāulake kahiha—please inform Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, who is playing the part of a madman in ecstatic love; loka—the people in general; ha-ila—have become; bāula—also mad in ecstatic love; bāulake kahiha—again inform Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, the bāula; hāṭe—in the market; nā—not; vikāya—sells; cāula—rice.
translation: "Please inform Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, who is acting like a madman, that everyone here has become mad like Him. Inform Him also that in the marketplace, rice is no longer in demand.
